cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles ESE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest on Friday, cross the Yucatan Peninsula late Saturday, then move north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana area) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast, near the mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coast from northern Nicaragua and Honduras, across the Yucatan Peninsula, and northward to the north-central Gulf Coast including Louisiana and Texas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts possible (30-40 mph) beginning late Monday or early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft surge along southeast Louisiana including the Lower Mississippi River delta
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches possible, producing localized flash flooding near the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas, rough surf, and river level rises that could impede vessel traffic on the Mississippi River
